intro: Humboltia hians, commonly known as the dwarf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Humboltia hians thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found growing along rocky shores or in coastal woodlands. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal.
